title: Aidoc, an AI Healthcare Startup, Nabs $110 Million Expansion Round
sub_head: Company’s software aims to help radiologists spot serious conditions—strokes, lung clots, brain bleeds and others—more quickly
body:
Aidoc, a startup that sells artificial intelligence-based software designed to help radiologists quickly spot strokes and other illnesses, has raised $110 million in new venture capital to increase the use of its technology in hospitals.
Aidoc, based in Tel Aviv and New York, is a part of a growing cast of startups seeking to use AI to make healthcare more efficient and effective, for instance, in speeding drug discovery, matching patients with clinical trials and helping drugmakers and physicians glean insights from data, among other uses.
